meanings.definition: A fixed amount of food or provisions given to soldiers or civilians during a shortage.
meanings.sent1: The soldiers received their daily rations before heading out on the mission.
meanings.sent2: During the war, people had to rely on rations to survive.
meanings.sent3: When the chef accidentally doubled the rations, everyone had more than enough to eat!
meanings.sent4: Her love for cooking was her emotional rations during tough times.
meanings.sent5: The image of the empty pantry stuck with him, a reminder of the importance of rations.

meanings.definition: To distribute provisions in fixed amounts.
meanings.sent1: The organization rations out supplies to ensure everyone gets a fair share.
meanings.sent2: They rationed the water carefully to make it last through the drought.
meanings.sent3: The teacher had to ration out the art supplies to the students for the project.
meanings.sent4: She had to ration her time between work and family responsibilities.
meanings.sent5: The coach rationed out playing time equally among all team members.
